intro: Lachenalia marlothii, commonly known as the Marloth’s lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from yellow to orange, bloom in late spring to early summer. Lachenalia marlothii is a popular choice for rock gardens due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
